author: Odeinoichus
title: You are My Son!
review:
Set #71020 Jor-El: The Father of Superman has featured in a single polybag set before now, made based off of Man-Of-Steel. This version represents the original Jor-El as played by Marlon Brando in design, though some of his detailing also appears to represent Comic Book Jor-El more closely as Brando did not have a beard, the costume printed on the torso and sloped leg brick is identical however with the S shield and the curious looking pattern running down the right side.

Jor-El includes a shoulder armour seen in the past with certain Classic Space era CMF figures, it features a small printed tile with the S shield on it. He carries a piece of blue crystal, possibly a reference to the crystals in the Fortress. It definitely is not Blue Kryptonite.

Overall, Jor-El is much appreciated here as it allows you to finally own the father of Superman. The S-Curl hairdo in white is also a nice touch, and so I recommend this Minifigure to all collectors and fans. Recommended.
